page.title: 01Severn Valley-Trimpley Area
page.content: The Trimpley and Dowles area of the Severn Valley is an area of great landscape value mostly designated Green Belt.It is divided by the River into 2 halves.To the West is part of Wyre Forest, both a commercial forest and a conservation area, parts being Sites of Special Scientific Interest. To the East is mostly farmland. Much of the housing in the area is expensive commuter housing, workers travelling up to 5 miles to local towns or up to 20 miles to the West Midlands Metropolitan Area. Problems common to this type of area are lack of homes for local young families and closure of village schools etc. The area is used by West Midland and local people for many recreational activities including fishing, boating and nature walks, and is crossed by the Severn Valley Steam Railway.
